document.docTitle: Ioniorhynchus henderickxi Hlaváč & Skuhrovec, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Endogean and cavernicolous Coleoptera of the Balkans. XV. A new species of the genus Ioniorhynchus Magrini, Meoli & Abbazzi, 2005 (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Entiminae) from Greece

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Endogean and cavernicolous Coleoptera of the Balkans. XV. A new species of the genus Ioniorhynchus Magrini, Meoli & Abbazzi, 2005 (Coleoptera: Curculionidae: Entiminae) from Greece

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined, HOLOTYPE ,
1 ♂
: [p] Greece : Zakynthos, Spilia Cagioti-Giri,
25 .IV. 2013
H. Henderickx lgt. / red label [p] HOLOTYPE
Ioniorhynchus henderickxi
sp. nov.
P. Hlaváč det., 2015 . (NMPC).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–3.
Ioniorhynchus henderickxi
sp. nov.
, Holotype, male, habitus: 1—dorsal view, 2—ventral view, 3—lateral view.

FIGURES 4–7.
Ioniorhynchus henderickxi
sp. nov.
, Holotype, male: 4—head, dorsal view, 5—head, lateral view, 6—left antenna, 7—antennal club.

FIGURES 8–11.
Ioniorhynchus henderickxi
sp. nov.
, Holotype, male: 8—pronotum, 9—elytra, 10—apex of elytra, dorsal view, 11—apex of elytra, lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Differential diagnosis.
Ioniorhynchus henderickxi
is similar to the sympatric species
I. doriae
and to
I. gasparoi (Osella & Zuppa, 2006 )
in the same shape of rostrum with large, prominent pterygia (
Figs 4, 5
; Magrini et al. 2005 :
Figs 2, 3
(
I. doriae
); Osella & Zuppa 2006 :
Fig. 1
(
I. gasparoi
)). Pterygia are only slightly defined in
I. loebli
(Magrini et al. 2005 : Figs 37, 38 ) and almost absent in
I. imprevisus
(Magrini et al. 2005 : Figs 19, 20 ). An additional common feature for
I. henderickxi , I. doriae
and
I. gasparoi
is the sinistrally (left) oriented apex of the aedeagus in ventral view (
Figs 14, 15
). In contrast, the apex of aedeagus is dextrally oriented in ventral view in
I. loebli
(Magrini et al 2005 : Figs 51, 52 ) and
I. imprevisus
(Magrini et al 2005 : Figs 32, 33 ).
Ioniorhynchus henderickxi
differs from
I. doriae
and
I. gasparoi
by the different shape of the apex of the elytra with a large projection oriented laterally downwards (
Figs 10, 11
; Magrini et al. 2005 :
Figs 8, 9
(both
I. doriae
); Osella & Zuppa 2006 :
Fig. 1
(
I. gasparoi
)), by different types of spines on the tibiae and femora (
Figs. 12, 13
; Magrini et al. 2005 :
Figs 11
, 12 (both
I. doriae
); Osella & Zuppa 2006 :
Fig. 2
(
I. gasparoi
)) and by the different shape of the aedeagus with the middle part straight (
Figs 14, 15
; Magrini et al. 2005 :
Figs 14, 15
(both
I. doriae
); Osella & Zuppa 2006 :
Fig. 3
(
I. gasparoi
)).
Etymology. Patronymic, named after Hans Henderickx, Belgium , specialist on Pseudoscorpionida and the collector of the holotype .
Biology. The specimen was collected only a few meters deep in the cave where there was still a little bit of light, under a wet piece of wood.
